title: Broken conda install Python 3.5/3.5 Conda 9.0
body_html:
Hi PyTorch-Team,

I just wanted to report the following install problem.

I copied the install instructions for Linux, conda install, python 3.5 (also tried 3.6) and CUDA 9.0.

It installs just fine but at import it raises the following error.

from torch._C import *
ImportError: /opt/intel/compilers_and_libraries_2018.1.163/linux/mkl/lib/intel64_lin/libmkl_gf_lp64.so: undefined symbol: mkl_lapack_ao_zgetrf

I work with miniconda3, CUDA 9.0, GPU: Tesla K80.

I just installed via pip3 now. That works flawlessly. So no urgency :) Just reporting.

Best,
Karen

body:
Hi PyTorch-Team,

I just wanted to report the following install problem. 

I copied the install instructions for Linux,  conda install, python 3.5 (also tried 3.6) and CUDA 9.0.


It installs just fine but at import it raises the following error.

```
from torch._C import *
ImportError: /opt/intel/compilers_and_libraries_2018.1.163/linux/mkl/lib/intel64_lin/libmkl_gf_lp64.so: undefined symbol: mkl_lapack_ao_zgetrf
```


I work with miniconda3, CUDA 9.0, GPU: Tesla K80.

I just installed via pip3 now. That works flawlessly. So no urgency :) Just reporting.

Best,
Karen
